chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa M. Somers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).
  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain a  HSED during the pendency of probation term.  Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment, unless medically excused by a treating physician.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program.   Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:26 p.m. Defendant Lisa M. Somers in court with attorney Amanda Belville.  Defendant Lisa M. Somers in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have received and reviewed the revocation packet - Cts 2 & 6 being sentenced today. No corrections or clarifications to be noted. The parties stipulate to 85 days CFTS. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Belville. Statement by DE.  Court orders: Ct 2 - 5 mos WCJ - Huber, GT, 85 days CFTS - Consecutive to Ct 4, Costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid, $79 Restitution converted to a civil judgment in favor of the Wild Rose Police Department.  Ct 6 - 5 mos WCJ - Concurrent with Ct 2/Consecutive to Ct 4.  Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 03-16-2016 02:15 pm

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 4:20 pm cases called-14CF73 & 14CM91. Defendant Lisa M. Somers in court with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Resolution reached and stated on record. Court addresses preliminary hearing with defendant. Defendant wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause a felony has been commited within the courts jurisdiction and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Keberlein confirms receipt, waives further reading. Defendant wishes to enter a plea today.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 2, Count 4, & Count 6.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 1, 3, 5, 7, & 8 and 14CM91. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Count 4- Impose 12 months WCJ, stayed and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years. Count 2- SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. Concurrent to Count 4. Count 6- SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years. Concurrent to Count 4.  CONDITIONS ON COUNT 4- 90 days WCJ, Credit for 73 days served. CONDITIONS ON ALL COUNTS: Participate and succesfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets program, AODA and follow through, Absolute Sobriety, No Bars, Not to ingest any impairing substances unless prescribed by a physician. Restitution of $79 to be paid within first 6 months of probation. HSED, Maintain employment, Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 6, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2014 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on July 15, 2014 at 09:35 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 14CF73 & 14CM91 Cases called @ 2:43 p.m. Defendant Lisa M. Somers in court with attorney Bryan D Keberlein.  Defendant Lisa M. Somers in custody.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. 14CF73 - The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. 14CM91 - NG plea entered. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. The court orders the bond in 14CF73 is applicable to both pending cases 14CF73 & 14CM91 as the bond previously posted in 14CM91 has been forfeited.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 09:35 am.
Restitution Summary and Statement of Loss/Damage - $79.00
Initial appearance on June 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Not to be in the possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription as to the medication and proper quantity.  Defendant is not to use any controlled substances without a valid prescription. BOND APPLICABLE TO BOTH 14CF73 AND 14CM91.

Case Called @ 1:30 PM: Defendant Lisa M. Somers in court with attorney Bryan D Keberlein, both appearing via video.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed.  ADA argues for significant cash bond w/conditions.  Argument as to bond by SPD - argues for lessor cash with no objection to nonmonetary conditions.  ADA states for the record the prior missed Court appearances.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

***AS PER OFF RECORD DISCUSSION WITH CT COMMISSIONER LORENSON FOLLOWING THE BOND HEARING:  The Court authorized  the withdrawal of the warrant issued as to 2014CM000091 for failure to appear on 5/5/14.   Case is to track along with the court appearing on June 10, 2014.
